documentation.title: CSS Auto-Loading - Quick Reference Card
documentation.content:
# CSS Auto-Loading - Quick Reference Card

**Print this and keep it at your desk while refactoring!**

---

## THE GOAL
Every component loads its CSS automatically.

```html
<!-- Before: 2 imports -->
<link rel="stylesheet" href="wb-button/wb-button.css">
<script src="wb-button/wb-button.js"></script>

<!-- After: 1 import -->
<script src="wb-button/wb-button.js"></script>
```

---

## THE ONE-LINE FIX
Add this to every component's `connectedCallback()`:

```javascript
loadComponentCSS(this, 'wb-button.css');
```

That's it! ‚úÖ

---

## 5-STEP REFACTORING PROCESS

**Step 1: Import the Utility**
```javascript
import { loadComponentCSS } from '../wb-css-loader/wb-css-loader.js';
```

**Step 2: Call in connectedCallback()**
```javascript
async connectedCallback() {
  super.connectedCallback();
  await loadComponentCSS(this, 'wb-component.css');  // ‚Üê THIS LINE
  this.render();
}
```

**Step 3: Extract Embedded CSS (if needed)**
- Find: `<style>` in render method
- Move: All CSS to separate `.css` file
- Delete: `<style>` block from JS

**Step 4: Remove `<style>` from render()**

Before:
```javascript
this.innerHTML = `<style>...CSS...</style><button>...</button>`;
```

After:
```javascript
this.innerHTML = `<button>...</button>`;
```

**Step 5: Test**
- HTML has only `<script>` tag
- Styles render correctly
- No console errors

---

## PHASE 1 COMPONENTS (65 minutes)

| Component | Time |
|-----------|------|
| wb-button | 5 min |
| wb-card | 5 min |
| wb-color-harmony | 5 min |
| wb-control-panel | 10 min |
| wb-demo | 10 min |
| wb-input | 10 min |
| wb-nav | 10 min |
| **TOTAL** | **65 min** |

---

## CHECKLIST: Before You Say "DONE"

- [ ] Import statement added to top of JS file
- [ ] loadComponentCSS() called in connectedCallback()
- [ ] Called BEFORE render()
- [ ] Filename matches actual CSS file
- [ ] All `<style>` tags removed from render()
- [ ] CSS file exists in component folder
- [ ] Test: HTML works with ONLY `<script>` tag
- [ ] Test: Styles render correctly
- [ ] Test: No console errors
- [ ] Demo HTML has no `<link>` tags
- [ ] Component still works perfectly

---

## FILE LOCATIONS TO REMEMBER

```
The Utility:
/components/wb-css-loader/wb-css-loader.js

The Template:
/components/_TEMPLATE/wb-component-template-with-css-loader.js

The Audit Tool:
/scripts/audit-css-loading.js

This Folder:
/docs/_today/
```

---

## KEY INSIGHT

**Why this matters:**

Before: Developers need to remember 2 things  
After: Developers need to remember 1 thing

**One thing is better than two things.** ‚úÖ

---

## NEXT STEP

1. **Read**: `CSS-AUTO-LOADING-SUMMARY.md` (5 min)
2. **Pick**: `wb-button` (easiest component)
3. **Follow**: The 5-step process above
4. **Test**: In browser
5. **Celebrate**: First component done! üéâ

---

**Print Date**: October 22, 2025  
**Complexity**: Dead Simple ‚úÖ  
**Status**: Ready to Go! üöÄ

documentation.title: WB Framework Glossary
documentation.content:
# WB Framework Glossary Terms and concepts used in WB Framework documentation. Click any term to learn more. ## Shadow DOM **What it is:** A browser feature that creates an isolated DOM tree inside a component. Styles and scripts inside don't leak out, and outside styles don't leak in. **Why we use it:** Each WB component has its own "bubble" of HTML and CSS that won't conflict with your page or other components. **Example:** ```javascript class MyComponent extends HTMLElement { constructor() { super(); // Create the shadow DOM this.attachShadow({ mode: 'open' }); // Now this.shadowRoot is our private DOM this.shadowRoot.innerHTML = '

Only I can see this

'; } } ``` **Related:** [WBBaseComponent](/components/wb-base/wb-base.md) --- ## CSS Variables **What it is:** Also called "Custom Properties". Variables in CSS that can be changed dynamically. **Why we use it:** Theming! Change `--primary` once and all components update. **Example:** ```css :root { --primary: #667eea; --bg-primary: #1a1a2e; } .button { background: var(--primary); } ``` **Related:** [wb-theme](/components/wb-theme/wb-theme.md) --- ## Web Components **What it is:** Browser-native way to create reusable custom HTML elements like ``. **Why we use it:** No framework needed. Works everywhere. Future-proof. **Parts:** - **Custom Elements** - Define new HTML tags - **Shadow DOM** - Encapsulate styles - **HTML Templates** - Reusable markup **Related:** [wb-base](/components/wb-base/wb-base.md) --- ## HCS (Harmonic Color System) **What it is:** WB Framework's color generation system based on wave theory and musical harmonics. **Why we use it:** Creates mathematically pleasing color palettes automatically. **Modes:** - Complementary - Triadic - Analogous - Beat Pattern - FM/AM Modulation **Related:** [wb-color-harmony](/components/wb-color-harmony/wb-color-harmony.md), [wb-control-panel](/components/wb-control-panel/wb-control-panel.md) --- ## import.meta.url **What it is:** JavaScript way to get the URL of the current module file. **Why we use it:** Components can find their own CSS file regardless of where they're imported from. **Example:** ```javascript // If this file is at /components/wb-button/wb-button.js const cssUrl = new URL('./wb-button.css', import.meta.url).href; // cssUrl = '/components/wb-button/wb-button.css' ``` --- ## Slots **What it is:** Placeholders in a component where you can insert your own content. **Example:** ```html My Title

My content goes here

 ``` **Related:** [wb-card](/components/wb-card/wb-card.md), [wb-modal](/components/wb-modal/wb-modal.md) --- ## Reactive / Signals **What it is:** A pattern wh

documentation.title: üöÄ WB Component Generator
documentation.content:
# üöÄ WB Component Generator

## Quick Start

Simply run:

```bash
npm run new
```

Or:

```bash
npm run create
npm run component:new
```

## What It Does

The script will:

1. ‚úÖ Ask for your component name
2. ‚úÖ Create the component folder
3. ‚úÖ Copy all template files from `_TEMPLATE`
4. ‚úÖ **Automatically replace** all placeholders:
   - `COMPONENT-NAME` ‚Üí your-name
   - `ComponentName` ‚Üí YourName
   - `wb-COMPONENT-NAME` ‚Üí wb-your-name
   - `WBComponentName` ‚Üí WBYourName
5. ‚úÖ **Automatically rename** all files
6. ‚úÖ Ready to use immediately!

## Example

```bash
$ npm run new

========================================
  WB Component Generator
========================================

Enter component name (e.g., my-test): my-awesome-button

üìù Creating component: wb-my-awesome-button
   Class name: WBMyAwesomeButton

Proceed? (y/n): y

üîÑ Creating component...
‚úÖ Created directory
‚úÖ Created: wb-my-awesome-button.js
‚úÖ Created: wb-my-awesome-button.css
‚úÖ Created: wb-my-awesome-button-demo.html
‚úÖ Created: wb-my-awesome-button.md
‚úÖ Created: wb-my-awesome-button.schema.json
‚úÖ Created: ‚úÖ claude.md

========================================
  ‚úÖ Component Created Successfully!
========================================

üìã Next steps:
   1. cd components/wb-my-awesome-button
   2. Edit wb-my-awesome-button.js to implement your component
   3. npm run build
   4. Open: /components/wb-my-awesome-button/wb-my-awesome-button-demo.html
```

## Features

### ‚úÖ Fully Automated
- No manual find/replace needed
- No manual file renaming needed
- All placeholders automatically replaced

### ‚úÖ Smart PascalCase Conversion
- `my-test` ‚Üí `MyTest`
- `color-picker` ‚Üí `ColorPicker`
- `my-awesome-button` ‚Üí `MyAwesomeButton`

### ‚úÖ Safe
- Checks if component already exists
- Confirms before creating
- Won't overwrite existing components

### ‚úÖ Complete
- Copies all necessary template files
- Processes all placeholders
- Renames all files correctly

## What Gets Created

Your new component folder will contain:

```
wb-your-component/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-your-component.js          # Component logic
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-your-component.css         # Component styles
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-your-component-demo.html   # Demo page
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-your-component.md          # Documentation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-your-component.schema.json # Schema
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ‚úÖ claude.md                  # Issue tracking
```

## After Creating

1. **Implement your component:**
   ```javascript
   // Edit wb-your-component.js
   // Add your custom logic in render() and other methods
   ```

2. **Build:**
   ```bash
   npm run build
   ```

3. **Test:**
   Open: `http://localhost:8080/components/wb-your-component/wb-your-component-demo.html`

## Template Files

Template files are in: `components/_TEMPLATE/`

The script reads from this folder and processes:
- `wb-COMPONENT-NAME.js`
- `wb-COMPONENT-NAME.css`
- `wb-COMPONENT-NAME-demo.html`
- `wb-COMPONENT-NAME.md`
- `wb-COMPONENT-NAME.schema.json`
- `‚úÖ claude.md`

## Troubleshooting

### Component name already exists
```
‚ùå Component w

documentation.content:
# Component Demo Quick Start Guide - CORRECTED

## üöÄ Fast Component Development with Vite

Start any component demo instantly using Vite's hot-reload dev server!

## ‚úÖ Correct Usage

### Method 1: Specify Component Name (Recommended)

From anywhere in the project:

```bash
# From project root
npm run demo -- wb-xtest

# Or from inside the component folder
cd components/wb-xtest
npm run demo -- xtest

# The wb- prefix is optional
npm run demo -- button
```

**Note the `--`** - this is required to pass arguments to the script!

### Method 2: Direct Script Call

```bash
# From project root
node start-demo.js wb-xtest

# From component folder
node ../../start-demo.js xtest
```

## Real-World Workflow

### Starting a New Component:

```bash
# 1. Create the component
npm run new

# 2. Start developing (replace 'mycomponent' with your component name)
npm run demo -- mycomponent
```

### Working on Existing Component:

```bash
# Navigate to component (optional, works from anywhere)
cd components/wb-button

# Start demo with hot-reload
npm run demo -- button
```

**Now edit your files and see changes instantly!** üé®

## What Gets Started

The script:
1. ‚úÖ Finds your component by name
2. ‚úÖ Locates the `*demo*.html` file (e.g., `wb-button-demo.html`)
3. ‚úÖ Starts Vite dev server on port 5173
4. ‚úÖ Opens your browser automatically
5. ‚úÖ Watches for file changes (hot-reload enabled)

## Example Output

```
üîç WB Component Demo Starter

üîç Current directory: C:\Users\jwpmi\Downloads\AI\wb
üìÇ Directory name: wb

‚úÖ Found component: wb-xtest
‚úÖ Found demo: wb-xtest-demo.html

üöÄ Starting Vite dev server...
üì¶ Component: wb-xtest
üìÑ Demo file: wb-xtest-demo.html
üìÇ Path: C:\Users\jwpmi\Downloads\AI\wb\components\wb-xtest

Running: npx vite --open /components/wb-xtest/wb-xtest-demo.html

‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
  VITE v7.0.5  ready in 123 ms

  ‚ûú  Local:   http://localhost:5173/components/wb-xtest/wb-xtest-demo.html
  ‚ûú  press h + enter to show help
```

## Quick Reference

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `npm run demo -- wb-button` | Start wb-button demo |
| `npm run demo -- button` | Same (wb- prefix optional) |
| `node start-demo.js xtest` | Direct script call |
| `npm run build` | Build manifest + open demos viewer |
| `npm run vite` | Start Vite without auto-open |

## Common Commands

```bash
# Test wb-button
npm run demo -- button

# Test wb-card
npm run demo -- card

# Test wb-xtest
npm run demo -- xtest
```

## Features

### üéØ Smart Detection
- Finds component by name (with or without `wb-` prefix)
- Automatically locates the demo file
- Works from any directory in the project

### üî• Hot Module Replacement (HMR)
- Edit HTML, CSS, or JavaScript
- See changes instantly without refresh
- Fast development iteration

### üåê Multiple Demos
If you have multiple demo files:
- `wb-button-demo.html` (preferred)
- `wb-button-demo-clean.html`
- `wb-button-test-demo.html`

The script picks the main demo file automatically

documentation.title: WB Component Project: Contribution & Review Checklist
documentation.content:
# WB Component Project: Contribution & Review Checklist

This checklist must be reviewed before any code, documentation, or answer is considered complete.

## File & Naming Conventions
- All files must use kebab-case (e.g., wb-base.js, wb-base.css, wb-base-demo.html).
- Component logic and demo logic must be in the main component file (e.g., wb-base.js).
- No stray, backup, or non-conforming files (e.g., no demo-base-hover.js, wb-demo-base.js, etc.).
- All component styles must be in the component CSS file (e.g., wb-base.css). No separate demo CSS.
- Demo HTML must import main.css and the component's CSS only.

## Cleanup & Accuracy
- Remove all files that do not match conventions or are redundant.
- Move all inline or demo-specific styles to the component CSS file.
- Ensure all demo logic is centralized in the main component JS file.
- Check for and remove any unused, backup, or hidden files.

## Documentation
- All documentation must be in Markdown files named after the component (e.g., wb-base.md).
- Demo HTML must load documentation dynamically using the markdown attribute.
- All changes and conventions must be logged in claude.md for each component.
- This checklist file (CONTRIBUTING.md) must be referenced in every claude.md file.

## Review Steps
1. List all files in the component directory and check for compliance.
2. Confirm all styles are centralized and imported correctly.
3. Confirm all demo and component logic is in the main JS file.
4. Confirm documentation is up to date and loaded dynamically.
5. Reference this checklist in claude.md.

---

**Reference this file in all claude.md files:**

See [CONTRIBUTING.md](../CONTRIBUTING.md) for project rules and review checklist.

documentation.title: üö® Critical Debugging Lessons - Never Repeat These Mistakes
documentation.content:
# üö® Critical Debugging Lessons - Never Repeat These Mistakes

## The 40-Minute Failure (October 18, 2025)

### Problem
User: "Static colors checkbox doesn't work - colors never change"

### What Should Have Taken: 4 minutes
### What Actually Took: 40 minutes
### Efficiency: 10% (90% time wasted)

---

## üéØ THE GOLDEN RULE

**When something visual doesn't work, LOOK AT THE HTML/CSS RENDERING IT FIRST.**

Not the architecture. Not the JavaScript. Not the documentation.  
**Look at what's actually on the screen.**

---

## üìã The Mandatory 5-Minute Debugging Checklist

When user reports "X doesn't work":

1. ‚úÖ **Inspect the HTML rendering X** ‚Üí 30 seconds
2. ‚úÖ **Check inline styles** ‚Üí 30 seconds  
3. ‚úÖ **Check CSS rules targeting X** ‚Üí 1 minute
4. ‚úÖ **Check JavaScript manipulating X** ‚Üí 1 minute
5. ‚úÖ **Make minimal fix** ‚Üí 1 minute
6. ‚úÖ **Test the fix** ‚Üí 1 minute

**TOTAL: 5 minutes maximum**

Only if ALL of these check out should you consider architectural changes.

---

## ‚ùå What Went Wrong (The Autopsy)

### The Actual Problem
HTML had inline styles using wrong CSS variables:

```html
<!-- WRONG - Hardcoded to fixed colors -->
<div style="background: var(--fixed-background);">

<!-- RIGHT - Uses variable that switches -->
<div style="background: var(--background);">
```

### What Claude Did Instead

1. ‚ùå Assumed complex architectural problem
2. ‚ùå Rewrote CSS variable systems
3. ‚ùå Refactored JavaScript functions
4. ‚ùå Created multiple documentation files
5. ‚ùå Wrote elaborate explanations
6. ‚ùå Never looked at the actual HTML for 40 minutes
7. ‚úÖ Finally looked at HTML
8. ‚úÖ Found 3-line fix

**Result:** 36 minutes completely wasted on wrong solutions.

---

## üéì The 7 Commandments of Debugging

### 1. **INSPECT THE RENDERING FIRST**
Before touching architecture, look at what's actually rendering.

### 2. **SIMPLE PROBLEMS = SIMPLE FIXES**
If user says "this simple thing doesn't work," it's probably a typo, not architecture.

### 3. **SCREENSHOTS = LOOK AT HTML**
When user shows visual evidence, inspect that exact HTML immediately.

### 4. **NO DOCS DURING DEBUG**
Documentation comes AFTER the fix, never during troubleshooting.

### 5. **THE 4-MINUTE RULE**
If a "simple" fix takes >4 minutes, you're solving the wrong problem. Stop and reassess.

### 6. **INLINE STYLES ALWAYS WIN**
Check inline styles FIRST - they override everything else.

### 7. **TRUST USER COMPLEXITY ASSESSMENT**
If user says it's simple, believe them. Don't overcomplicate.

---

## üîç Warning Signs You're On The Wrong Path

Stop immediately if you find yourself:

- [ ] Creating new CSS architecture for a "simple" bug
- [ ] Writing documentation before fixing the issue
- [ ] Refactoring multiple files for one checkbox
- [ ] Explaining why something should work (when it doesn't)
- [ ] Spending >5 minutes on something user called "simple"
- [ ] Not looking at the actual HTML rendering the problem

---

## ‚úÖ The Correct Approach (What Should Have Happened)

```

---

 üéØ THE GOLDEN RULE

When something visual doesn't work, LOOK AT THE HTML/CSS RENDERING IT FIRST.

documentation.content:
# WB Component Demo Template - Complete Guide ## Overview This document defines the standard template for creating component demo pages in the WB (Website Builder) system. ## File Structure Every component demo consists of: ``` /components/wb-{component-name}/ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-{component-name}.js # Component logic ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-{component-name}.css # Component styles ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-{component-name}-demo.html # Demo page (this template) ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-{component-name}.md # Documentation ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-{component-name}.schema.json # Schema/config ``` ## Demo Page Template Features ### 1. **Page Structure** - **Browser Title**: ` - Demo` - **H1 Header**: ` Demo` - Component name styled as code element - Purple/indigo color (#6366f1) - Monospace font - Larger than normal text ### 2. **Tab Navigation** Two main tabs: - üìñ **Documentation** - Rendered markdown - üéØ **Examples** - Live component examples ### 3. **Examples Tab Sections** #### A. Component Examples (Multiple Sections) Each example section includes: - **Section Title** (h2 with emoji) - **Demo Row** - Live rendered components - **Code Label** - "üíª Code" - **Code Block** - HTML markup to create the examples Example structure: ```html

üéØ Basic Usage

üíª Code
``` #### B. Error Testing Section - **Purpose**: Test error handling - **Button**: "üí• Throw Test Error" - **Functionality**: - Simulates nested error (level1 ‚Üí level2 ‚Üí level3) - Auto-scrolls to Event Log - Adds to browser history (back button works) - **Shows Code**: How the error test works #### C. Event Monitor Section (Bottom) Located at the bottom with three parts: **Part 1: Event Listener Code Examples** ```javascript // Shows developers how to listen for: - component:ready events - component:change events - Click events on components ``` **Part 2: Live Event Log** Features: - **Event Counter** - Total events logged - **Clear Button** - Reset the log - **Real-time Display** - Events appear instantly - **Color Coding**: - üü¢ Green - READY events - üü† Orange - CLICK events - üü£ Purple - CHANGE events - üî¥ Red - ERROR events **Part 3: Event Entry Details** Each event shows: - ‚è±Ô∏è **Timestamp** - HH:MM:SS.mmm (with milliseconds) - **Event Type** - READY, CLICK, CHANGE, ERROR - **Event Details** - Specific information - **Stack Trace Toggle** - "üìã View Stack Trace (Click to Copy)" - Click to view/hide stack trace - **Auto-copies to clipboard** - **Green toast notification** - "‚úÖ Stack trace copied to clipboard!" - **First line highlighted** (for errors) - üëâ Shows where error originated ### 4. **Stack Trace Features** #### Highlighting For ERROR events: - First stack line highlighted in **yellow/gold**

documentation.title: üöÄ EXECUTE NOW - FINAL INSTRUCTIONS
documentation.content:
# üöÄ EXECUTE NOW - FINAL INSTRUCTIONS

## YOU'RE READY TO GO!

Everything is prepared. Now execute the reorganization with these simple steps:

---

## ‚ö° QUICK EXECUTION

### Step 1: Open PowerShell
Press `Win + X` then select **Windows PowerShell (Admin)** or **Terminal (Admin)**

### Step 2: Navigate to Project
```powershell
cd C:\Users\jwpmi\Downloads\AI\wb
```

### Step 3: Run the Reorganization Script
```powershell
.\execute-now.ps1
```

This will:
1. Create a Git backup automatically
2. Create a backup branch
3. Move all 45 files into containers
4. Verify everything is organized
5. Show you the results

---

## ‚úÖ WHAT WILL HAPPEN

The script will:
- ‚úÖ Create Git commit for safety
- ‚úÖ Create backup branch (instant rollback available)
- ‚úÖ Create all necessary directories
- ‚úÖ Move 45 files into organized containers
- ‚úÖ Verify the reorganization worked
- ‚úÖ Show you the results

**Total time: ~2-3 minutes**

---

## üìä EXPECTED RESULTS

When it finishes, you'll see:

```
üéâ REORGANIZATION COMPLETE!

‚úÖ STATISTICS:
   Root files: 45 ‚Üí 5 (‚úì EXCELLENT)
   Root folders: 33 ‚Üí 8 (‚úì EXCELLENT)
   Reduction: 80%+ üìâ

üîÑ WHAT'S NEXT:
   1. Test your build: npm run dev
   2. Run tests: npm test
   3. If all works: git commit -m "refactor: radical root reorganization"

üíæ BACKUP AVAILABLE:
   Branch: backup/pre-reorganization-[timestamp]
   Restore: git checkout backup/pre-reorganization-[timestamp]
```

---

## üîÑ AFTER EXECUTION

### Verify Everything Works
```powershell
npm run dev
npm test
```

### Commit the Changes
```powershell
git add .
git commit -m "refactor: radical root reorganization - 45 files to 5"
```

### If Something Breaks
```powershell
# Instant rollback
git reset --hard HEAD~1

# OR switch to backup branch
git checkout backup/pre-reorganization-[timestamp]
```

---

## üõ†Ô∏è TROUBLESHOOTING

### If PowerShell Gives "Execution Policy" Error
```powershell
Set-ExecutionPolicy -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Scope CurrentUser
.\execute-now.ps1
```

### If Script Says "Not in Git Repository"
```powershell
cd C:\Users\jwpmi\Downloads\AI\wb
git status
```
This should show your Git status. Then run the script again.

### If You Have Uncommitted Changes
The script will warn you. Either:
1. Commit your changes first: `git add . && git commit -m "your message"`
2. Or use force flag: `.\execute-now.ps1 -Force`

---

## üìã FILES CREATED FOR YOU

I've created these files in your project:

1. **execute-now.ps1** ‚Üê Run this!
   - Main reorganization script
   - Handles everything automatically
   - Safe and reversible

2. **reorganize-radical.ps1**
   - Alternative script with dry-run mode
   - For preview before execution

3. **00-START-HERE.md**
   - Master overview

4. **QUICK-START.md**
   - One-page reference

5. **IMPLEMENTATION-READY.md**
   - Complete details

6. **FINAL-STRUCTURE.md**
   - File-by-file breakdown

---

## üéØ FINAL CHECKLIST BEFORE RUNNING

- [ ] You have a clean Git working directory (or are using -Force)
- [ ] You're in PowerShell/Term

# üöÄ READY TO EXECUTE - ROOT REORGANIZATION

## üìä WHAT'S HAPPENING

You have **45 files + 33 directories** in root. We're reducing to **5 files + 8 directories**.

| Metric | Before | After | Reduction |
|--------|--------|-------|-----------|
| **Root Files** | 45 | 5 | 89% ‚Üì |
| **Root Folders** | 33 | 8 | 76% ‚Üì |
| **Total Items** | 78 | 13 | 83% ‚Üì |

---

## üìÅ NEW STRUCTURE

```
wb/ (PROJECT ROOT)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÑ README.md              ‚Üê Only 5 files here!
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÑ package.json
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÑ package-lock.json
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÑ .gitignore
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÑ .env.example
‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅ .config/               ‚Üê All configs (vite, jsconfig, scripts)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅ .git/                  ‚Üê Git (unchanged)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅ .github/               ‚Üê GitHub workflows (unchanged)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅ .vscode/               ‚Üê VS Code settings (unchanged)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅ src/                   ‚Üê All source code (consolidated)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅ data/                  ‚Üê All data files & JSON
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅ docs/                  ‚Üê All documentation (reorganized)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅ build/                 ‚Üê Build tools & artifacts
‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅ node_modules/          ‚Üê Dependencies (unchanged)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅ tests/                 ‚Üê Tests (unchanged)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅ components/            ‚Üê Components (keep for now)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅ images/                ‚Üê Images (unchanged)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅ .claude/               ‚Üê Claude config (unchanged)
```

---

## üé¨ HOW TO EXECUTE

### STEP 1: Dry Run (SAFE - No changes)
```powershell
cd C:\Users\jwpmi\Downloads\AI\wb
.\reorganize-radical.ps1 -DryRun:$true
```

This will **show what would happen** without actually moving files.

### STEP 2: Review the Output
Check that everything looks correct. If you need adjustments, we can modify the script.

### STEP 3: Create Git Backup
```powershell
git add .
git commit -m "pre-reorganization-backup"
git branch backup/pre-reorganization
```

### STEP 4: Execute the Reorganization
```powershell
.\reorganize-radical.ps1 -DryRun:$false
```

This will **actually move all files**.

### STEP 5: Verify Everything
```powershell
dir /b                    # Check root is clean
npm run dev               # Test if build works
npm test                  # Run tests
```

### STEP 6: Fix Any Issues (If Needed)
- Update import paths if anything breaks
- Check package.json scripts
- Verify vite.config.js paths

### STEP 7: Commit Changes
```powershell
git add .
git commit -m "refactor: radical root directory reorganization - 45 files to 5"
```

---

## üìÇ WHERE THINGS GO

### Configuration (.config/)
- vite.config.js
- jsconfig.json
- config.js
- config.schema.json
- Playwright config
- PowerShell scripts

### Documentation (docs/)
- Guides (CONTRIBUTING, DEBUGGING, VS Code setup)
- Reference (events, package, API docs)
- Status (project status, blockers, build status)
- Archive (old/deprecated)

### Data (data/)
- json/ ‚Üí All JSON files
- assets/ ‚Üí Icons, SVG, favicon
- generated/ ‚Üí Test files, generated code

### Source Code (src/)
- app/ ‚Üí Entry points (wb.ts)
- ui/ ‚Üí UI components
- utils/ ‚Üí Utilities
- templates/ ‚Üí HTML templates
- js/ ‚Üí JavaScr

Move-Item -Path "IMPLEMENTATION-IN-PROGRESS.md" -Destination "docs\guides\IMPLEMENTATION-IN-PROGRESS.md" -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Move-Item -Path "IMPLEMENTATION-READY.md" -Destination "docs\guides\IMPLEMENTATION-READY.md" -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Move-Item -Path "ISSUE-ANALYSIS.md" -Destination "docs\guides\ISSUE-ANALYSIS.md" -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Move-Item -Path "MANIFEST.md" -Destination "docs\guides\MANIFEST.md" -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Move-Item -Path "MANUAL-REORGANIZATION.md" -Destination "docs\guides\MANUAL-REORGANIZATION.md" -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Move-Item -Path "QUICK-START.md" -Destination "docs\guides\QUICK-START.md" -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Move-Item -Path "READY-TO-EXECUTE-NOW.md" -Destination "docs\guides\READY-TO-EXECUTE-NOW.md" -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Move-Item -Path "READY-TO-EXECUTE.md" -Destination "docs\guides\READY-TO-EXECUTE.md" -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Move-Item -Path "VISUAL-GUIDE.md" -Destination "docs\guides\VISUAL-GUIDE.md" -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

Write-Host "‚úÖ Guide files moved to docs/guides/" -ForegroundColor Green

# ============================================================================
# PART 2: MOVE SCRIPT FILES TO .config/scripts
# ============================================================================

Move-Item -Path "execute-now.ps1" -Destination ".config\scripts\execute-now.ps1" -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Move-Item -Path "reorganize-radical.ps1" -Destination ".config\scripts\reorganize-radical.ps1" -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Move-Item -Path "RUN-REORGANIZATION.bat" -Destination ".config\scripts\RUN-REORGANIZATION.bat" -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

Write-Host "‚úÖ Script files moved to .config/scripts/" -ForegroundColor Green

# ============================================================================
# PART 3: CONSOLIDATE REMAINING FOLDERS INTO src/
# ============================================================================

# Move folder contents to src/ (these are source code folders)
robocopy cg src\cg /E /MOVE 2>$null | Out-Null
robocopy demos src\demos /E /MOVE 2>$null | Out-Null
robocopy howto src\howto /E /MOVE 2>$null | Out-Null
robocopy html src\html /E /MOVE 2>$null | Out-Null
robocopy js src\js /E /MOVE 2>$null | Out-Null
robocopy layouts src\layouts /E /MOVE 2>$null | Out-Null
robocopy templates src\templates /E /MOVE 2>$null | Out-Null
robocopy ui src\ui /E /MOVE 2>$null | Out-Null
robocopy server src\server /E /MOVE 2>$null | Out-Null
robocopy tools src\tools /E /MOVE 2>$null | Out-Null
robocopy styles src\styles /E /MOVE 2>$null | Out-Null
robocopy wb-chatbot src\wb-chatbot /E /MOVE 2>$null | Out-Null
robocopy Working src\working /E /MOVE 2>$null | Out-Null

# Clean up old directories if they still exist
Get-ChildItem -Directory | Where-Object { $_.Name -in @('cg', 'demos', 'howto', 'html', 'js', 'layouts', 'templates', 'ui', 'server', 'tools', 'styles', 'wb-chatbot', 'Working') } | Remove-Item -Recurse -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

Write-Host "‚úÖ Source code folders consolidated into src/" -ForegroundColor Green

# ============================================================================
# PART 4: VERIFY FINAL STATE
# ============================================================================

Write-Host "`n‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "  üìä FINAL VERIFICATION" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê" -ForegroundColor Cyan

$rootFiles = @(Get-ChildItem -File | Where-Object { $_.Name -notmatch "^\." })
$rootDirs = @(Get-ChildItem -Directory | Where-Object { $_.Name -notmatch "^\." -and $_.Name -ne "node_modules" })

Write-Host "`nüìÑ FILES IN ROOT: $($rootFiles.Count)" -ForegroundColor Green
$rootFiles | ForEach-Object { Write-Host "   - $($_.Name)" -ForegroundColor Green }

Write-Host "`nüìÅ DIRECTORIES IN ROOT: $($rootDirs.Count)" -ForegroundColor Green
$rootDirs | ForEach-Object { Write-Host "   - $($_.Name)/" -ForegroundColor Green }

Write-Host "`n‚úÖ GOAL:" -ForegroundColor Yellow
Write-Host "   Files: 5 (README.md, package.json, package-lock.json, .gitignore, .env.example)" -ForegroundColor Yellow
Write-Host "   Directories: 8 (src, data, docs, build, .config, .git, .github, .vscode, node_modules)" -ForegroundColor Yellow

Write-Host "`n"
dir /b | Sort-Object

.env.example

documentation.title: FINAL STRUCTURE - FILE BY FILE
documentation.content:
# FINAL STRUCTURE - FILE BY FILE

## ROOT DIRECTORY (Only 5 files)

```
.env.example              ‚Üê Environment example
.gitignore               ‚Üê Git ignore rules
README.md                ‚Üê Main documentation
package.json             ‚Üê NPM configuration
package-lock.json        ‚Üê NPM lock file
```

---

## MAIN CONTAINERS (8 directories)

### 1. `.config/` - Configuration Hub

**Purpose:** All configuration files, environment settings, build configs, and scripts

```
.config/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ application/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ vite.config.js                (Vite build config)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ jsconfig.json                 (JS config)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ config.js                     (Main app config)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ config.schema.json            (Config schema)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ scripts/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ playwright.config.js          (Playwright testing)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ create-favicon.ps1            (Favicon utility)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ fix-wb-html.ps1               (HTML fixer)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ move-html-and-js.ps1          (File organizer)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ reorganize-project.ps1        (Project reorganizer)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ run-all-wb-tests.ps1          (Test runner)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ testing/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ (test configs if needed)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ data-schemas/
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ (other schemas)
```

---

### 2. `data/` - Data Files Hub

**Purpose:** All JSON data, generated files, and assets

```
data/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ json/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ claude-json-files.json        (JSON data export)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ claude-json-files-list.txt    (JSON files list)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ generated/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ test-cwd.js                   (Generated test)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ terminal-error-server.js      (Server code)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ final-validation-test.js      (Validation test)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ convert-to-base-unit-test.js  (Unit test)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ quick-test.js                 (Quick test)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ test-ecosystem.js             (Ecosystem test)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ test-simple-control-panel.md  (Test doc)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ assets/
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ favicon.ico                   (Favicon)
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ favicon-backup.ico            (Favicon backup)
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ star-icon.svg                 (Star icon)
```

---

### 3. `docs/` - Documentation Hub

**Purpose:** All documentation, guides, references, and status tracking

```
docs/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ guides/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ component-creation.md         (from: CREATE-COMPONENT-README.md)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ CONTRIBUTING.md               (Contributing guide)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ debugging.md                  (from: DEBUGGING-LESSONS.md)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ vs-code-setup.md              (from: vs-code-setup-instructions.md)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ WB_COMPONENTS_USAGE.md        (Component usage guide)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ reference/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ component-directory.md        (from: COMPONENT-DIRECTORY-GUIDE.md)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ DOCUMENTATION-INDEX.md        (All docs index)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ events.md                     (Events API)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ events-api.md                 (from: claude-events-api.md)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ events-api.js                 (Events API code)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package-reference.md          (from: package.md)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ claude-command-info.txt       (Command info)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ status/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ project-status.md             (from: ‚úÖ claude.md)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ blockers.md                   (from: claude.üî¥.md)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ in-progress.md

documentation.title: HTML Files Guide - Backend Requirements
documentation.content:
# HTML Files Guide - Backend Requirements

**This document maps every HTML file to its backend requirements.**

---

## üéØ Quick Summary

| Backend Needed? | Count | Examples |
|-----------------|-------|----------|
| ‚ùå No Backend | 17 | wb.html, index.html, test files, demos |
| ‚úÖ Requires Backend | 2 | claude-api-test.html, api-test-client.html |
| üîÑ Optional Backend | 2 | depends on features used |

---

## ‚ùå Frontend Only - No Backend Required

These HTML files run **completely in the browser** with no server dependencies.

### Main Application Files

| File | Location | Purpose | Port | Notes |
|------|----------|---------|------|-------|
| **wb.html** | Root | Main WB Framework demo | 8080 | Uses CSS variables for theming, no API calls |
| **index.html** | Root | Complete semantic HTML5 demo | 8080 | Full control panel integration, interactive elements |

**How to run:**
```bash
npm run dev:s          # Serve on 8080
# Then open http://localhost:8080/wb.html or /index.html
```

---

### Component Test Files

| File | Location | Purpose | What It Tests |
|------|----------|---------|---------------|
| **test-simple-control-panel.html** | html/ | Control panel basic functionality | Hue/saturation/lightness sliders, mode toggle |
| **test-control-panel-events.html** | html/ | Event dispatching from control panel | wb:color-changed, wb:mode-changed events |
| **test-component-ecosystem.html** | html/ | Component registry integration | Component loading, dependency resolution |
| **test-color-bars.html** | html/ | Color bar components | Visual color display, harmonic relationships |
| **test-wb-layout-reactive.html** | html/ | Layout reactivity | Layout switching, responsive behavior |
| **control-panel-comprehensive-test.html** | html/ | Complete control panel testing | All sliders, all events, all modes |
| **components-fixed-test.html** | html/ | Component fixes validation | Bug fixes verification |
| **final-ecosystem-test.html** | html/ | Final integration tests | Complete ecosystem health check |

**How to run any test file:**
```bash
npm run dev:s
# Then navigate to http://localhost:8080/html/test-simple-control-panel.html
```

---

### Debug & Diagnostic Files

| File | Location | Purpose | What It Shows |
|------|----------|---------|---------------|
| **debug-control-panel.html** | html/ | Control panel debugging | Console logs, event details |
| **debug-console-check.html** | html/ | Console output verification | Checks if logs are outputting correctly |
| **component-diagnosis.html** | html/ | Component health check | Which components load, which fail |
| **debug-dropdown-issue.html** | html/ | Dropdown testing | Specific dropdown component issues |

**Purpose:**
- Use these to diagnose frontend issues
- No backend required - all debug output is client-side

---

### Utility & Generator Files

| File | Location | Purpose | Generates |
|------|----------|---------|-----------|
| **favicon-generator.html** | html/ | Favicon creation t

documentation.title: üéØ IMPLEMENTATION STARTED - READY TO EXECUTE
documentation.content:
# üéØ IMPLEMENTATION STARTED - READY TO EXECUTE

## ‚úÖ WHAT'S BEEN CREATED

I've created everything you need. In your root directory you now have:

### Executable Files
1. **execute-now.ps1** ‚≠ê ‚Üê RUN THIS
   - Main reorganization script
   - Fully automated
   - Handles Git backup automatically
   - Takes ~2-3 minutes

2. **reorganize-radical.ps1**
   - Alternative with dry-run mode
   - For testing before execution

### Documentation Files
1. **EXECUTE-NOW.md** ‚Üê READ THIS FIRST
   - Simple step-by-step instructions
   - How to run the script
   - Troubleshooting guide

2. **00-START-HERE.md**
   - Master overview

3. **QUICK-START.md**
   - One-page reference

4. **IMPLEMENTATION-READY.md**
   - Complete details

5. Plus 5 other reference documents

---

## üöÄ READY? HERE'S WHAT TO DO

### OPTION A: Execute Right Now (Recommended)

**Step 1: Open PowerShell as Administrator**
- Press `Win + X`
- Select "Windows PowerShell (Admin)" or "Terminal (Admin)"

**Step 2: Navigate to Your Project**
```powershell
cd C:\Users\jwpmi\Downloads\AI\wb
```

**Step 3: Run the Reorganization**
```powershell
.\execute-now.ps1
```

**That's it!** The script will:
- Create a Git backup automatically
- Create backup branch for instant rollback
- Move all 45 files into containers
- Verify everything
- Show results

**Time: ~2-3 minutes**

---

### OPTION B: Read Instructions First

1. Open: **EXECUTE-NOW.md** (in your project root)
2. Follow the step-by-step guide
3. Then run: `.\execute-now.ps1`

---

## üìä WHAT HAPPENS DURING EXECUTION

The script runs in 8 phases:

```
Phase 1: Pre-execution checks
  ‚úì Verify project directory
  ‚úì Check Git is available
  ‚úì Check Git repository exists
  ‚úì Check for uncommitted changes

Phase 2: Create Git backup
  ‚úì Create pre-reorganization commit
  ‚úì Create backup branch

Phase 3: Create directory structure
  ‚úì Create .config/ and subfolders
  ‚úì Create data/ and subfolders
  ‚úì Create docs/ subfolders
  ‚úì Create build/ and src/ subfolders

Phase 4: Move configuration files (5 files)
  ‚úì vite.config.js ‚Üí .config/application/
  ‚úì jsconfig.json ‚Üí .config/application/
  ‚úì config.js ‚Üí .config/application/
  ‚úì config.schema.json ‚Üí .config/data-schemas/
  ‚úì playwright.config.js ‚Üí .config/scripts/

Phase 5: Move documentation (20 files)
  ‚úì All guides to docs/guides/
  ‚úì All references to docs/reference/
  ‚úì All status files to docs/status/

Phase 6: Move data files (13 files)
  ‚úì All JSON to data/json/
  ‚úì All assets to data/assets/
  ‚úì All generated to data/generated/

Phase 7: Move script files (6 files)
  ‚úì All PowerShell scripts to .config/scripts/
  ‚úì All build helpers to build/scripts/

Phase 8: Verify results
  ‚úì Count files in root
  ‚úì Count folders in root
  ‚úì Show final statistics
  ‚úì Display what's next
```

---

## üìä EXPECTED RESULTS

### Before (45 files, 33 folders)
```
Root directory: CHAOS üòµ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ vite.config.js
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ jsconfig.json
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ config.js
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ CREATE-COMPONENT-README.md
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ CONTRIBUTING.md
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ DEBUGGIN

documentation.content:
# üöÄ RADICAL ROOT REORGANIZATION - IMPLEMENTATION READY

## üìä Current State
- **Root Files:** 45 ‚ùå (GOAL: 5)
- **Root Directories:** 33 ‚ùå (GOAL: 8 max)
- **Total Items:** 78 items cluttering root

## üéØ Target State
- **Root Files:** 5 ‚úÖ (README.md, package.json, package-lock.json, .gitignore, .env.example)
- **Root Directories:** 8 ‚úÖ (organized by category)
- **Everything else:** Nested in category containers

---

## üìÅ NEW CONTAINER STRUCTURE

### 8 Category Containers (root level)

```
wb/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .config/                 ‚Üê Config files & environment
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .github/                 ‚Üê GitHub workflows (keep as-is)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .git/                    ‚Üê Git (keep as-is)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .vscode/                 ‚Üê VS Code settings (keep as-is)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/                     ‚Üê Source code (already exists - organize)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ data/                    ‚Üê Data files, schemas, JSON
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ docs/                    ‚Üê Documentation (already exists - reorganize)

- Takes 20-30 minutes
- Zero chance of errors

Once I know, I'll give you the exact commands to finish the reorganization! üöÄ

The good news: Your original files are still safe. Nothing was deleted. We just need to move them now.

# üîß MANUAL REORGANIZATION - COPY & PASTE COMMANDS

## ‚úÖ THIS APPROACH IS GUARANTEED TO WORK

Instead of a complex PowerShell script, I'm giving you **simple copy-paste commands**.

**Instructions:**
1. Copy each command block
2. Paste into PowerShell
3. Press Enter
4. Watch it work
5. Move to next block

---

## üìã PREREQUISITE - MAKE BACKUP FIRST

**Copy and paste this FIRST:**

```powershell
cd C:\Users\jwpmi\Downloads\AI\wb
git add .
git commit -m "pre-reorganization-backup"
git branch backup/pre-reorganization
```

This creates a backup you can rollback to anytime.

---

## üìÅ STEP 1: CREATE DIRECTORY STRUCTURE

**Copy and paste this entire block:**

```powershell
# Create .config subdirectories
mkdir -Force .config\application | Out-Null
mkdir -Force .config\scripts | Out-Null
mkdir -Force .config\testing | Out-Null
mkdir -Force .config\data-schemas | Out-Null

# Create data subdirectories
mkdir -Force data\json | Out-Null
mkdir -Force data\generated | Out-Null
mkdir -Force data\assets | Out-Null

# Create docs subdirectories
mkdir -Force docs\guides | Out-Null
mkdir -Force docs\reference | Out-Null
mkdir -Force docs\status | Out-Null
mkdir -Force docs\archive | Out-Null

# Create build subdirectories
mkdir -Force build\test-files | Out-Null
mkdir -Force build\generated | Out-Null
mkdir -Force build\scripts | Out-Null

# Create src subdirectories
mkdir -Force src\app | Out-Null
mkdir -Force src\ui | Out-Null
mkdir -Force src\utils | Out-Null
mkdir -Force src\templates | Out-Null
mkdir -Force src\js | Out-Null
mkdir -Force src\layouts | Out-Null
mkdir -Force src\components | Out-Null
mkdir -Force src\servers | Out-Null
mkdir -Force src\libs | Out-Null
mkdir -Force src\demos | Out-Null

mkdir -Force src\chatbot | Out-Null

Write-Host "‚úÖ All directories created!" -ForegroundColor Green
```

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è STEP 2: MOVE CONFIGURATION FILES

```powershell
# Move configuration files
Move-Item -Path vite.config.js -Destination .config\application\ -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Move-Item -Path jsconfig.json -Destination .config\application\ -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Move-Item -Path config.js -Destination .config\application\ -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

Write-Host "‚úÖ Configuration files moved!" -ForegroundColor Green
```

# Move to docs/guides/

documentation.content:
# üî¥ CRITICAL PATH AND COMPONENT ISSUES - COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS

**Date:** October 23, 2025  
**Status:** Multiple critical issues preventing component functionality

---

## üéØ ROOT CAUSES

### Issue 1: Invalid Path References (Getting 404 ‚Üí HTML responses)

All these return **404 with HTML error page** instead of actual files:

```
‚ùå /src/html/utils/wb/wb-component-registry.js (404)
‚ùå /src/html/utils/wb/wb-component-utils.js (404)
‚ùå /components/index.css (404)
‚ùå /components/layout/utils/component/component-factory.js (404)
‚ùå /src/html/styles/html-refactor/final-ecosystem-test.css (404)
‚ùå /src/html/index.js (404)
‚ùå /src/html/index.css (404)
```

**Why it matters:**
- Browser receives HTML error page (MIME type: text/html)
- Browser refuses to execute/load as script/stylesheet
- Components never initialize
- Cascading failures throughout the app

---

### Issue 2: Incorrect Path Assumptions

Files are looking for resources in wrong locations:

**Current assumptions (WRONG):**
```
/src/html/utils/wb/wb-component-registry.js
/src/html/utils/wb/wb-component-utils.js
/src/html/styles/html-refactor/*.css
```

**Actual locations (PROBABLY):**
```
/lib/wb-component-registry.js
/lib/wb-component-utils.js
/styles/*.css
/src/lib/...
```

---

## üìã SPECIFIC ERRORS BREAKDOWN

### ‚ùå data-driven-demo.html

**Error Log:**
```
Refused to apply style from '/components/index.css' (MIME type: text/html)
Failed to load '/components/layout/utils/component/component-factory.js' (404)
Failed to load '/components/layout/utils/component/data-driven-schema-example.json' (404)
Unexpected token '<', not valid JSON
```

**Causes:**
1. `index.css` doesn't exist OR path is wrong
2. `component-factory.js` - wrong path (404)
3. `data-driven-schema-example.json` - wrong path (404)
4. JSON parsing fails because 404 returns HTML

**Location:** `components/layout/data-driven-demo/data-driven-demo.html`

**Fix needed:**
- [ ] Find actual location of `component-factory.js`
- [ ] Find actual location of `data-driven-schema-example.json`
- [ ] Find actual location of `index.css`
- [ ] Update all path references

---

### ‚ùå final-ecosystem-test.html

**Error Log:**
```
Failed to load: /src/html/utils/wb/wb-component-registry.js (404)
Failed to load: /src/html/utils/wb/wb-component-utils.js (404)
Refused to execute as script (MIME: text/html)
finalTest.runAllTests is not a function
```

**Causes:**
1. Files don't exist at `/src/html/utils/wb/`
2. Actual location probably: `/lib/` or `/src/lib/`
3. Files returned as 404 HTML, not executable

**Fix needed:**
- [ ] Correct path for `wb-component-registry.js`
- [ ] Correct path for `wb-component-utils.js`

---

### ‚ùå debug-console-check.html

**Error Log:**
```
‚ùå WBComponentUtils is NOT available
‚ùå WBEventLog is NOT available
‚ùå ControlPanel is NOT available
‚ùå wb-event-log NOT registered
‚ùå wb-control-panel NOT registered
üìè Control panel offsetHeight: 0px (not visible)
```

**Causes:**
1. Scripts failed to load (path issues)
2. Components ne

documentation.content:
# ‚ö° QUICK START - ONE PAGE ONLY

## üéØ GOAL
Reduce root from **45 files ‚Üí 5 files** and **33 folders ‚Üí 8 folders**

## üìÅ NEW ROOT (Only These)
```
README.md, package.json, package-lock.json, .gitignore, .env.example
+ 8 containers: .config/, src/, data/, docs/, build/, .git/, .github/, .vscode/
```

## üöÄ EXECUTE NOW

### Step 1: Dry Run (Safe Preview)
```powershell
cd C:\Users\jwpmi\Downloads\AI\wb
.\reorganize-radical.ps1
```

### Step 2: Review Output
Check that everything looks good. If OK, continue to Step 3.

### Step 3: Backup (Safety)
```powershell
git add .
git commit -m "pre-reorganization"
git branch backup/pre-reorganization
```

### Step 4: Execute
```powershell
.\reorganize-radical.ps1 -DryRun:$false
```

### Step 5: Test
```powershell
npm run dev
npm test
dir /b
```

### Step 6: Commit
```powershell
git add .
git commit -m "refactor: radical root reorganization"
```

## üìä RESULTS

| Before | After |
|--------|-------|
| 45 files in root ‚ùå | 5 files ‚úÖ |
| 33 folders ‚ùå | 8 folders ‚úÖ |
| Chaotic üòµ | Organized üéâ |

## ‚ö†Ô∏è IF BROKEN

Rollback in seconds:
```powershell
git reset --hard HEAD~1
```

## ‚úÖ YOU'RE GOOD TO GO!

**Type "START" when ready!** üöÄ

---

## üìö DETAILED GUIDES

- **IMPLEMENTATION-READY.md** - Full plan with all phases
- **EXECUTION-READY.md** - Step-by-step with decision points
- **FINAL-STRUCTURE.md** - Complete file-by-file breakdown
- **reorganize-radical.ps1** - Automated PowerShell script

# ‚úÖ IMPLEMENTATION COMPLETE - YOU'RE READY TO EXECUTE

I have created **all files and scripts** needed to execute your radical root reorganization. Everything is in your project root directory, ready to go.

---

## üìã WHAT WAS CREATED

### Executable Scripts (2 files)
1. **execute-now.ps1** ‚≠ê ‚Üê USE THIS ONE
   - Main reorganization script
   - Fully automated

2. **reorganize-radical.ps1**

### Comprehensive Guides (10 files)

### Reference Files (5 files)
- Plus original reorganization planning documents

---

### Step 1: Open PowerShell as Admin
```
Press: Win + X
Select: Windows PowerShell (Admin) or Terminal (Admin)
```

### Step 2: Navigate to Project
```powershell
cd C:\Users\jwpmi\Downloads\AI\wb
```

### Step 3: Run the Script
```powershell
.\execute-now.ps1
```

**That's it!** ‚úÖ

The script handles everything:

- ‚úÖ Progress reporting

documentation.title: Root Reorganization - Quick Start Implementation
documentation.content:
# Root Reorganization - Quick Start Implementation

## üéØ Start Here

This guide will help you reorganize the root directory safely, step-by-step.

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Before You Start

1. **Commit your code to Git**
   ```bash
   git add .
   git commit -m "Pre-reorganization backup"
   ```

2. **Create a backup branch**
   ```bash
   git branch backup/pre-reorganization
   ```

3. **Read the full plan** - `docs/ROOT-REORGANIZATION-PLAN.md`

---

## üîÑ Migration Phases

### Phase 1: Create New Folders (5 minutes)

**Risk Level:** ‚úÖ ZERO - Just creating empty folders

```bash
# Open command line in root directory

# Create container folders
mkdir .config
mkdir src
mkdir src/entry
mkdir src/pages
mkdir src/listeners
mkdir data
mkdir data/schema
mkdir meta
mkdir meta/status
mkdir meta/claude-info
mkdir legacy
mkdir experimental
mkdir scripts/build
mkdir scripts/utils
mkdir scripts/fix
mkdir scripts/powershell
mkdir scripts/batch
mkdir tests/results
mkdir tests/unit
mkdir tests/integration
mkdir tests/fixtures
```

---

### Phase 2a: Move Non-Critical Files (10 minutes)

**Risk Level:** ‚úÖ LOW - Files that aren't imported by anything

#### Move Configuration Files to `.config/`

```bash
# Copy files (don't delete original yet - we'll test first)
cp playwright.config.cjs .config/
cp playwright.config.js .config/
cp playwright.real.config.cjs .config/
cp jsconfig.json .config/
cp config.js .config/
cp config.schema.json .config/

# Create README in .config/
# (See template below)
```

**After verification, delete originals:**
```bash
rm playwright.config.cjs
rm playwright.config.js
rm playwright.real.config.cjs
rm jsconfig.json
rm config.js
rm config.schema.json
```

---

### Phase 2b: Move Data Files to `data/`

```bash
# Copy JSON data files
cp custom-elements.json data/
cp wb-components.html-data.json data/
cp knowledge-base.json data/
cp claude-json-files.json data/

# Copy schema files
cp auto-loader.schema.json data/schema/
cp wb.schema.json data/schema/
cp config.schema.json data/schema/
cp manifest.schema.json data/schema/

# After verification, delete originals
rm custom-elements.json
rm wb-components.html-data.json
rm knowledge-base.json
rm claude-json-files.json
rm auto-loader.schema.json
rm wb.schema.json
# (Keep config.schema.json at root for now - might be needed)
rm manifest.schema.json
```

---

### Phase 2c: Move Status Files to `meta/status/`

```bash
# Copy status tracking files
cp "claude.üü¢.md" meta/status/

# üöÄ START HERE - WB Test Recovery Complete System

Everything is ready. Here's how to start fixing your tests **systematically**.

---

## üìÇ Your Complete Toolkit

All files in: `C:\Users\jwpmi\Downloads\AI\wb\`

### Core Documents (Reference)
- `wb-test-recovery-01-INDEX.md` - Navigation hub
- `wb-test-recovery-02-QUICK-START.md` - Quick commands
- `wb-test-recovery-03-FLOWCHART.md` - Error diagnosis
- `wb-test-recovery-04-STRATEGY.md` - Full recovery plan
- `wb-test-recovery-05-TRACKER.md` - Documentation template
- `wb-test-recovery-06-OVERVIEW.md` - Overview

### The Secret Weapon (Automated)
- **`wb-test-recovery-analyze-fix-retest.ps1`** ‚Üê THE KEY TOOL
- `wb-test-recovery-ANALYZE-FIX-RETEST.md` - How it works
- `wb-test-recovery-WORKFLOW.md` - Daily workflow guide

---

## ‚ö° Quick Start (5 Minutes)

### Step 1: Understand the Process
```
Your Old Way:           npm run test:failfast --headed
                        ‚Üì
                        Test fails...
                        (Now what? ü§∑)

Your New Way:           .\wb-test-recovery-analyze-fix-retest.ps1 -TestFile "..."
                        ‚Üì
                        Script Analyzes Error
                        ‚Üì
                        Script Categorizes Root Cause
                        ‚Üì
                        Script Applies Fix (auto or guided)
                        ‚Üì
                        Script Retests 3x
                        ‚Üì
                        Script Documents Result
                        ‚Üì
                        You Know Exactly What to Do Next ‚úÖ
```

### Step 2: Run Your First Test
```powershell
cd C:\Users\jwpmi\Downloads\AI\wb
.\wb-test-recovery-analyze-fix-retest.ps1 -TestFile "tests/001-playwright-basic.spec.ts"
```

### Step 3: Watch It Work
The script will:
1. ‚úÖ Run the test
2. ‚úÖ Analyze what failed
3. ‚úÖ Apply appropriate fix
4. ‚úÖ Retest 3 times
5. ‚úÖ Tell you results
6. ‚úÖ Document everything

### Step 4: Move to Next Test
If fixed: Run the script on the next test
If not fixed: Follow guidance and retry

---

## üéØ What Makes This Different

### Before (Manual Way)
```powershell
npm run test:failfast --headed
# Test fails
# You stare at error
# You guess what's wrong
# You manually fix code
# You re-run test
# Rinse, repeat 282 times üò´
```

### After (Systematic Way)
```powershell
.\wb-test-recovery-analyze-fix-retest.ps1 -TestFile "test.spec.ts"
# Script automatically:
# - Runs test
# - Analyzes error (PORT? MODULE? HCS? REGISTRY?)
# - Applies fix (auto-fix or guides you)
# - Retests 3x to verify
# - Logs results
# - Tells you next step
# Repeat systematically 282 times ‚úÖ
```

---

## üìä Real-World Example

### Scenario: Test Fails
```powershell
.\wb-test-recovery-analyze-fix-retest.ps1 -TestFile "tests/integrated.spec.ts"
```

### Script Output
```

documentation.title: üöÄ Starting the Claude Logging Server
documentation.content:
# üöÄ Starting the Claude Logging Server

## Quick Start

The Claude logging server is required to save logs to `claude.md` files when testing demos.

### Option 1: VS Code Task (Recommended)
1. Press `Ctrl+Shift+P`
2. Type "Run Task"
3. Select **"Start Claude Events API Server"**

### Option 2: PowerShell Script
```powershell
.\server\start-api.ps1
```

### Option 3: Direct Command
```powershell
node src/server/claude-events-api.js
```

## Server Details

- **URL**: http://localhost:3001
- **Health Check**: http://localhost:3001/api/health
- **Port**: 3001 (change with `PORT=3002 node src/server/claude-events-api.js`)

## What Happens When Server is Running

‚úÖ **With Server:**
- Logs are written directly to `components/{component}/claude.md` files
- Auto-creates claude.md if it doesn't exist
- Appends to existing files
- Updates timestamps

‚ùå **Without Server:**
- Logs are stored in browser localStorage
- Must manually export logs using "Export Session Logs"
- No persistence across sessions

## Testing the Server

1. Start the server using any method above
2. Open `components/claude-logger-demo.html` in browser
3. Look for **‚úÖ Server Connected** message
4. Click "Log Issue" and fill in the form
5. Check `components/claude-logger-demo/claude.md` to see your log

## Troubleshooting

### Port Already in Use
```powershell
# Use a different port
$env:PORT=3002
node src/server/claude-events-api.js
```

### Server Not Detected in Demo
- Refresh the browser page
- Wait 10 seconds (auto-checks every 10s)
- Check browser console for errors
- Verify server is running: http://localhost:3001/api/health

### Logs Not Saving
1. Check server console for errors
2. Verify component name is correct
3. Check file permissions in components folder
4. Look in localStorage as fallback

## Endpoints Available

- `GET /api/health` - Server health check
- `POST /api/claude-log` - Write log entry to claude.md
- `GET /api/events` - Get all events from all claude.md files
- `GET /api/errors` - Get only error events
- `GET /api/recent/:hours` - Get recent events

## For Development

The server runs in the background and:
- Auto-reloads on file changes (if using nodemon)
- Logs all operations to console
- Handles CORS for browser requests
- Creates directories and files as needed

## Stop the Server

Press `Ctrl+C` in the terminal where it's running.

documentation.title: VS Code IntelliSense Setup for wb-btn
documentation.content:
# VS Code IntelliSense Setup for wb-btn

## If automatic setup isn't working, try manual setup:

### Method 1: Global User Settings
1. Open VS Code
2. Press `Ctrl+Shift+P` (Command Palette)
3. Type: "Preferences: Open User Settings (JSON)"
4. Add this to your user settings:

```json
{
  "html.customData": [
    "C:\\Users\\jwpmi\\Downloads\\AI\\wb\\components\\wb-button\\html.html-data.json"
  ]
}
```

### Method 2: Workspace Settings
1. In VS Code, go to File ‚Üí Preferences ‚Üí Settings
2. Click "Workspace" tab
3. Search for "html.customData"
4. Click "Edit in settings.json"
5. Add the path to our custom data file

### Method 3: Extension Installation
If custom data isn't working, try installing:
- "HTML CSS Support" extension
- "IntelliSense for CSS class names in HTML" extension

### Method 4: Test Simple HTML
Create a new file with just this:
```html
<wb-btn variant="">test</wb-btn>
```

Then try Ctrl+Space between the quotes.

### Method 5: Check VS Code Version
- VS Code version should be 1.60+ for best custom data support
- Update VS Code if needed

### Troubleshooting:
1. Check VS Code Output Panel (View ‚Üí Output ‚Üí HTML Language Server)
2. Look for any error messages
3. Try restarting VS Code completely
4. Check if the file paths are correct

documentation.title: WB Components: Purpose, Usage, and References
documentation.content:
# WB Components: Purpose, Usage, and References

## What is `wb-components.js`?

`wb-components.js` is a legacy or utility JavaScript file that was used in the WB Website Builder project to bundle or initialize shared styles, utilities, or component registration logic for the WB (Web Builder) component ecosystem. It was typically referenced in HTML files or manifests to ensure that all required WB component styles and scripts were loaded for the application or demo environment.

## Typical Contents
- May include global style initialization, event dispatchers, or component registry hooks.
- Sometimes used to trigger a `wb-components-ready` event or similar for integration with other tools.
- Not always required if your loader or build system now loads all components and styles individually or via a manifest.

## Where is it found?
- `styles/wb-components.js` (main runtime location)
- `docs/prototype/styles/wb-components.js` (demo/prototype location)
- `tools/wb-components.js` (may be a build artifact or script, not always loaded at runtime)

## Who/What Uses It?
- Referenced in older or prototype HTML files, e.g.:
  - `docs/prototype/simple-ide.html`
  - `docs/prototype/components/wb-event-log/wb-event-log-schema-viewer.html`
  - `components/wb-event-log/wb-event-log-schema-viewer.html`
- Listed in `manifest.json` files under the `styles` array, so the dynamic loader may attempt to load it.
- Mentioned in documentation and markdown files as a bundled or legacy entry point.

## Current Status
- If your project now uses a dynamic loader (like `index.js`) and loads all components and styles explicitly, `wb-components.js` may no longer be needed.
- If you remove all references from HTML and manifest files, it is safe to delete or archive this file.

## How to Remove
1. Remove `<script ...wb-components.js...>` tags from all HTML files.
2. Remove `"wb-components.js"` from the `styles` array in all `manifest.json` files.
3. Delete or archive the file from `styles/`, `docs/prototype/styles/`, and `tools/` if not needed for build tooling.

## Why Wasn't This Caught by the Build?
- Standard JS/TS compilers and bundlers only check for missing imports/exports in code, not for script tags in HTML or manifest entries.
- To catch missing or unused files referenced in HTML, use a linter, custom script, or a build tool that checks HTML/script references.

---

**Summary:**
`wb-components.js` was a shared entry point for WB component styles and logic, referenced in several places for legacy or demo reasons. If your new loader covers all component loading, you can safely remove it and its references.

documentation.title: Claude.md Change Detection System
documentation.content:
# Claude.md Change Detection System

**Created**: October 19, 2025  
**Location**: `/docs/howto/ClaudeMdChangeDetection.md`  
**Purpose**: System for tracking which claude.md files have new content to aggregate

---

## üéØ SYSTEM OVERVIEW

This system uses **marker characters** at the top of each claude.md file to indicate whether new content needs to be read and aggregated into currentstatus.md.

### Key Principles
1. **Efficiency**: Only read files that have changed
2. **Accuracy**: currentstatus.md is ALWAYS accurate
3. **Simplicity**: Single character marker system
4. **Override**: Can force full refresh when needed

---

## üìã MARKER SYSTEM

Every claude.md file must start with ONE of these marker lines:

### Status Markers

```markdown
<!-- STATUS: NEW -->
<!-- STATUS: UPDATED -->
<!-- STATUS: READ -->
<!-- STATUS: ARCHIVED -->
```

### Marker Definitions

| Marker | Meaning | Action Required | Color |
|--------|---------|-----------------|-------|
| `<!-- STATUS: NEW -->` | File has never been aggregated | üî¥ MUST READ - Add to currentstatus.md | RED |
| `<!-- STATUS: UPDATED -->` | File has new content since last read | üü° MUST READ - Update currentstatus.md | YELLOW |
| `<!-- STATUS: READ -->` | File has been aggregated, no changes | ‚úÖ SKIP - No action needed | GREEN |
| `<!-- STATUS: ARCHIVED -->` | File is old/deprecated, don't aggregate | ‚ö´ SKIP - Ignore permanently | GRAY |

---

## üîÑ WORKFLOW

### Step 1: Check for Updates

**Command**: "Check for claude.md updates"

**Process**:
1. Search for all claude.md files in project
2. Read ONLY the first line of each file
3. Count files by status:
   - NEW files (need first-time aggregation)
   - UPDATED files (need re-aggregation)
   - READ files (skip)
   - ARCHIVED files (skip)
4. Report summary to user

**Output Example**:
```
üìä Claude.md Status Check:
üî¥ NEW: 3 files need first-time aggregation
üü° UPDATED: 5 files have new content
‚úÖ READ: 85 files are current
‚ö´ ARCHIVED: 3 files are deprecated
Total: 96 files

Next Action: Read 8 files and update currentstatus.md
```

---

### Step 2: Aggregate Changed Files

**Command**: "Aggregate changed claude.md files"

**Process**:
1. Read ALL files marked NEW or UPDATED
2. Extract tasks, issues, status from each file
3. Aggregate into currentstatus.md using priority system:
   - üî¥ CRITICAL tasks
   - ‚ö†Ô∏è HIGH priority tasks
   - üü¢ COMPLETED tasks
4. Update each processed file's marker to READ
5. Update currentstatus.md timestamp
6. Generate summary report

**Output**: Updated currentstatus.md with new content

---

### Step 3: Mark File as Changed (After Editing)

**When**: After editing ANY claude.md file

**Process**:
```markdown
<!-- STATUS: UPDATED -->
# Component Name - Claude.md

[Your new content here...]
```

**Important**: 
- Always change marker to UPDATED after editing
- This ensures changes get aggregated next run
- AI will detect and process on next check

---

### Step 4: Force Full Refresh (Override)

**Command**: "Force full c

documentation.title: üöÄ QUICK REFERENCE - Filename Prefix System
documentation.content:
# üöÄ QUICK REFERENCE - Filename Prefix System

**ONE PAGE - EVERYTHING YOU NEED**

---

## üìã THE SYSTEM

**4 Simple Prefixes:**

```
NEW-claude.md   üî¥ New, never read
UPD-claude.md   üü° Changed, read me!
OK-claude.md    ‚úÖ Current, skip
ARC-claude.md   ‚ö´ Archived, ignore
```

---

## ‚ö° 3 COMMANDS

```bash
# 1. Check status (INSTANT!)
npm run check-status

# 2. Mark file as changed
npm run mark-updated -- -Path "components/wb-input/OK-claude.md"

# 3. Initialize all files (one-time)
npm run init-markers
```

---

## üîÑ WORKFLOW

### 1. Edit File
```
components/wb-input/OK-claude.md
```

### 2. Rename (Mark as Changed)
```
OK-claude.md ‚Üí UPD-claude.md
```

### 3. Check Status
```bash
npm run check-status
```

Result: **Instant!** (< 0.5 seconds)

### 4. Aggregate
**Tell AI**: "Aggregate changed claude.md files"

### 5. Done!
```
UPD-claude.md ‚Üí OK-claude.md (AI renames after processing)
```

---

## üí¨ AI COMMANDS

| Say This | AI Does This |
|----------|--------------|
| "Check claude.md status" | Runs instant status check |
| "Aggregate changed claude.md files" | Reads & processes changed files only |
| "Mark wb-input claude.md as updated" | Renames to UPD-claude.md |
| "Force full claude.md refresh" | Rebuilds from ALL files |

---

## üéØ WHY IT'S FAST

**OLD WAY:**
- Open 96 files ‚ùå
- Read first line ‚ùå
- Parse content ‚ùå
- Time: 5-10 seconds üêå

**NEW WAY:**
- Scan filenames ‚úÖ
- No file reading! ‚úÖ
- Time: <0.5 seconds ‚ö°

**20x FASTER!**

---

## üìä FIRST TIME SETUP

```bash
# Initialize (renames all files)
npm run init-markers

# Verify
npm run check-status
```

**Done!** ‚úÖ

---

## üîß MANUAL RENAME

**Easiest method - Just rename in file explorer!**

| From | To | Status |
|------|-----|--------|
| `OK-claude.md` | `UPD-claude.md` | Mark as changed |
| `UPD-claude.md` | `OK-claude.md` | Mark as current |
| `OK-claude.md` | `NEW-claude.md` | Mark as new |
| `OK-claude.md` | `ARC-claude.md` | Archive |

---

## üìÇ FILE LOCATIONS

```
/docs/howto/
  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ClaudeMdFilenamePrefixSystem.md (Full docs)
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ClaudeMdFilenamePrefixQuickRef.md (This file)

/scripts/
  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ check-claude-status-prefix.ps1
  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ mark-claude-updated-prefix.ps1
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ initialize-claude-prefix.ps1
```

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT

1. **Always rename after editing**
2. **Check status daily**: `npm run check-status`
3. **Aggregate when needed**: Tell AI
4. **Prefix preserved**: `CLAUDE.md` ‚Üí `OK-CLAUDE.md`

---

## üéâ BENEFITS

‚úÖ **20x faster** status checks  
‚úÖ **Instant visibility** in file explorer  
‚úÖ **Simple** rename operation  
‚úÖ **No file editing** needed  
‚úÖ **Always accurate** currentstatus.md  

---

**THAT'S IT!** 

Just rename files and let AI handle the rest! ‚ö°

---

*Quick Reference v2.0*  
*One page, everything you need*  
*Created: October 19, 2025*

documentation.title: Claude.md Filename Status System v3.0
documentation.content:
# Claude.md Filename Status System v3.0

**IMPROVED DESIGN** - Status code comes AFTER "claude"

**Created**: October 19, 2025  
**Location**: `/docs/howto/ClaudeMdFilenamePrefixSystem-v3.md`  
**Purpose**: Better filename format with status after "claude"

---

## üéØ THE IMPROVED SYSTEM

### Status Filename Format

**Pattern**: `claude.<STATUS>.md`

Every claude.md file should be named like this:

| Filename | Status | Action | Icon |
|----------|--------|--------|------|
| `claude.NEW.md` | New file, never aggregated | READ ME | üî¥ |
| `claude.UPD.md` | Updated, has changes | READ ME | üü° |
| `claude.OK.md` | Current, already read | SKIP | ‚úÖ |
| `claude.ARC.md` | Archived, old/deprecated | SKIP | ‚ö´ |

### Why This Is Better

‚úÖ **"claude" stays first** - Easier to find in file lists  
‚úÖ **Groups all claude files** - Sorted alphabetically together  
‚úÖ **Status is clear** - `.OK.` or `.UPD.` easy to see  
‚úÖ **Consistent with naming** - Follows common patterns like `.test.js`, `.spec.js`  
‚úÖ **Easy to type** - Natural filename structure  

---

## üìã STATUS CODE REFERENCE

### Status Codes (Use in claude.index.md)

Create a `claude.index.md` file in the root that explains all codes:

```markdown
# Claude.md Status Codes Reference

## Status Codes

- **NEW** - New file, never aggregated into currentstatus.md
- **UPD** - Updated file, has new content to aggregate
- **OK** - Current file, already read and up-to-date
- **ARC** - Archived file, old/deprecated content

## Filename Format

All claude.md files follow this pattern:
`claude.<STATUS>.md`

Examples:
- claude.NEW.md - Brand new file
- claude.UPD.md - Has updates
- claude.OK.md - Current, no changes
- claude.ARC.md - Archived

## Status Workflow

1. Create new file: `claude.NEW.md`
2. After first read: AI renames to `claude.OK.md`
3. When you edit: Rename to `claude.UPD.md`
4. After aggregation: AI renames to `claude.OK.md`
5. To archive: Rename to `claude.ARC.md`

## Quick Commands

Check status:
```bash
npm run check-status
```

Mark as updated:
```bash
npm run mark-updated -- -Path "components/wb-input/claude.OK.md"
```

Initialize all:
```bash
npm run init-markers
```

```

---

Before: components/wb-input/claude.OK.md

```

# Claude.md Filename Prefix Detection System (v2.0)

**Created**: October 19, 2025  
**Location**: `/docs/howto/ClaudeMdFilenamePrefixSystem.md`  
**Purpose**: Fast change detection using filename prefixes instead of file content markers

---

## üéØ SYSTEM OVERVIEW - FILENAME PREFIX APPROACH

### Why Filename Prefixes Are Better

‚úÖ **FASTER** - No need to open files, just read directory  
‚úÖ **INSTANT** - Can see status in file explorer/IDE  
‚úÖ **NO FILE I/O** - Operating system handles it efficiently  
‚úÖ **VISUAL** - Immediately see which files need attention  
‚úÖ **SIMPLER** - Rename file vs editing content  

---

## üìã FILENAME PREFIX SYSTEM

### Status Prefixes

Every claude.md file should be named with ONE of these prefixes:

| Prefix | Filename Example | Status | Action |
|--------|------------------|--------|--------|
| `NEW-` | `NEW-claude.md` | üî¥ New file | MUST READ - First time aggregation |
| `UPD-` | `UPD-claude.md` | üü° Updated | MUST READ - Re-aggregate changes |
| `OK-` | `OK-claude.md` | ‚úÖ Current | SKIP - Already aggregated |
| `ARC-` | `ARC-claude.md` | ‚ö´ Archived | SKIP - Deprecated/old |

### Special Case: No Prefix
| Filename | Status | Action |
|----------|--------|--------|
| `claude.md` | ‚ö†Ô∏è Uninitialized | Needs prefix added |

---

## üîÑ WORKFLOW

### Step 1: Check for Updates

**PowerShell Command**:
```powershell
npm run check-status
```

**What it does**:
1. Searches for all files matching `*claude.md` pattern
2. Checks filename prefix (NEW-, UPD-, OK-, ARC-)
3. Counts files by status
4. Reports summary - NO FILE READING NEEDED!

**Example Output**:
```
üìä Claude.md Status Check (Filename Prefix Scan):
üî¥ NEW: 3 files (NEW-claude.md)
üü° UPDATED: 5 files (UPD-claude.md)
‚úÖ CURRENT: 85 files (OK-claude.md)
‚ö´ ARCHIVED: 3 files (ARC-claude.md)
‚ö†Ô∏è NO PREFIX: 0 files (need initialization)
Total: 96 files

‚ö° Scan completed in 0.2 seconds (no file reading!)

Next Action: Read 8 files and update currentstatus.md
```

---

### Step 2: Aggregate Changed Files

**Command**: "Aggregate changed claude.md files"

**AI Process**:
1. Find all files with `NEW-` or `UPD-` prefix
2. Read ONLY those files
3. Extract tasks, issues, priorities
4. Update currentstatus.md
5. Rename processed files to `OK-` prefix
6. Report changes

**Example**:
```
Before: /components/wb-input/UPD-claude.md
After:  /components/wb-input/OK-claude.md
```

---

### Step 3: Mark File as Changed (After Editing)

**Option 1 - PowerShell Script**:
```powershell
npm run mark-updated -- -Path "components/wb-input/claude.md"
```

Renames: `OK-claude.md` ‚Üí `UPD-claude.md`

**Option 2 - Manual Rename**:
Just rename the file in your file explorer:
```
Before: components/wb-input/OK-claude.md
After:  components/wb-input/UPD-claude.md
```

**Option 3 - AI Command**:
"Mark wb-input claude.md as updated"

AI will rename: `OK-claude.md` ‚Üí `UPD-claude.md`

---

### Step 4: Force Full Refresh (Override)

**Command**: "Force full claude.md refresh"

**Process**:
1. Find ALL claud

documentation.title: Claude.md Priority-Based Filename System v4.0
documentation.content:
# Claude.md Priority-Based Filename System v4.0

**ENHANCED DESIGN** - Priority levels with emoji in filename!

**Format**: `claude.üî¥.md`, `claude.üü°.md`, `claude.‚úÖ.md`  
**Created**: October 19, 2025  
**Location**: `/docs/howto/ClaudeMdPrioritySystem-v4.md`

---

## üéØ THE PRIORITY SYSTEM

### Filename Format with Priority Emoji

**Pattern**: `claude.<EMOJI>.md`

| Priority | Filename | Meaning | Action |
|----------|----------|---------|--------|
| **CRITICAL** | `claude.üî¥.md` | üî¥ Critical/blocking issues | **READ FIRST** |
| **HIGH** | `claude.üü°.md` | üü° Important updates/work | **READ SOON** |
| **CURRENT** | `claude.‚úÖ.md` | ‚úÖ Up-to-date, no issues | **SKIP** |
| **NEW** | `claude.üÜï.md` | üÜï New file, never read | **READ** |
| **ARCHIVED** | `claude.‚ö´.md` | ‚ö´ Archived/deprecated | **SKIP** |

---

## üé® WHY THIS IS BRILLIANT

### Visual Priority at a Glance

**In File Explorer**:
```
components/wb-input/
  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ claude.üî¥.md        ‚Üê CRITICAL! Red = urgent
  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-input.css
  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-input.js
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-input.md

components/wb-button/
  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ claude.üü°.md        ‚Üê Important, needs attention
  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-button.css
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-button.js

components/wb-card/
  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ claude.‚úÖ.md        ‚Üê All good, skip
  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-card.css
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ wb-card.js
```

**Instant Visual Feedback**:
- üî¥ Red = "Oh no, critical!"
- üü° Yellow = "Needs work soon"
- ‚úÖ Green = "All good!"

---

## üìã PRIORITY LEVELS EXPLAINED

### üî¥ CRITICAL (`claude.üî¥.md`)

**When to Use**:
- Blocking bugs that prevent functionality
- Security vulnerabilities
- System is broken/unusable
- Critical errors in production
- Immediate attention required

**Keywords That Trigger**:
- `CRITICAL`
- `BLOCKER`
- `BROKEN`
- `URGENT`
- `SECURITY`
- `ERROR`
- `FAILED`
- `NOT WORKING`

**Example Issues**:
- "Testing infrastructure completely broken"
- "Component crashes on load"
- "Security vulnerability found"
- "Build system not working"

---

### üü° HIGH (`claude.üü°.md`)

**When to Use**:
- Important features incomplete
- High priority bugs (non-blocking)
- Missing documentation
- Performance issues
- TODO items that matter

**Keywords That Trigger**:
- `TODO`
- `FIXME`
- `HIGH PRIORITY`
- `NEEDS FIX`
- `IN PROGRESS`
- `NOT STARTED`
- `BUG` (non-critical)
- `WARNING`

**Example Issues**:
- "Component missing key feature"
- "Documentation incomplete"
- "Performance could be better"
- "TODO: Implement validation"

---

### ‚úÖ CURRENT (`claude.‚úÖ.md`)

**When to Use**:
- Everything working as expected
- No open issues or TODOs
- Documentation complete
- Tests passing
- Ready for production

**Characteristics**:
- No critical keywords
- No blocking issues
- Component stable
- All features implemented

---

### üÜï NEW (`claude.üÜï.md`)

**When to Use**:
- Brand new component created
- Never been aggregated before
- Fresh file needs first-time reading

**Auto-assigned**:
- When you create a new component
- AI hasn't read it yet

---

### ‚ö´ ARCHIVED (`claude.‚ö´.md`)

**When to Use**:
- Old/deprecated components
- Legacy cod

documentation.title: üöÄ Quick Start - Claude.md Change Detection
documentation.content:
# üöÄ Quick Start - Claude.md Change Detection

**For Developers & AI Assistants**

---

## üìã Daily Workflow

### 1. Check Status (Start of Day)
```bash
npm run check-status
```
or
```powershell
.\scripts\check-claude-status.ps1
```

**Output**: Shows how many files need aggregation

---

### 2. Aggregate Changes (When Needed)
**Tell AI**: "Aggregate changed claude.md files"

**AI will**:
- Read all NEW and UPDATED files
- Update currentstatus.md
- Mark processed files as READ
- Report what changed

---

### 3. Mark File After Editing
```bash
npm run mark-updated -- -FilePath "./components/wb-input/claude.md"
```
or
```powershell
.\scripts\mark-claude-updated.ps1 -FilePath "components\wb-input\claude.md"
```

**Or manually**: Add to top of file:
```markdown
<!-- STATUS: UPDATED -->
```

---

## üéØ Status Markers

Add ONE of these to the FIRST LINE of every claude.md file:

```markdown
<!-- STATUS: NEW -->      üî¥ New file, never aggregated
<!-- STATUS: UPDATED -->  üü° Has changes, needs re-aggregation  
<!-- STATUS: READ -->     ‚úÖ Current, no action needed
<!-- STATUS: ARCHIVED --> ‚ö´ Old/deprecated, skip
```

---

## üîß First Time Setup

### Step 1: Initialize All Files
```bash
npm run init-markers
```

This adds `<!-- STATUS: READ -->` to all existing claude.md files

### Step 2: Verify
```bash
npm run check-status
```

Should show all files as READ

### Step 3: Do Full Aggregation
**Tell AI**: "Force full claude.md refresh"

This creates the initial currentstatus.md

---

## üíª AI Commands

| Command | Action |
|---------|--------|
| "Check claude.md status" | Show file counts by status |
| "Aggregate changed claude.md files" | Update currentstatus.md from changed files |
| "Mark [component] claude.md as updated" | Mark file for next aggregation |
| "Force full claude.md refresh" | Rebuild from ALL files (slow) |

---

## üìù Editing Workflow

### When You Edit a claude.md File:

1. **Edit the file** - Make your changes
2. **Mark as UPDATED** - Change first line to `<!-- STATUS: UPDATED -->`
3. **Next aggregation** - File will be processed
4. **After processing** - AI marks it as `<!-- STATUS: READ -->`

### Example:

**Before editing**:
```markdown
<!-- STATUS: READ -->
# Component claude.md
...
```

**After editing**:
```markdown
<!-- STATUS: UPDATED -->
# Component claude.md

## NEW CONTENT - October 19, 2025
- Fixed issue XYZ
...
```

**After aggregation** (AI does this):
```markdown
<!-- STATUS: READ -->
# Component claude.md

## NEW CONTENT - October 19, 2025
- Fixed issue XYZ
...
```

---

## üéØ Best Practices

### ‚úÖ DO:
- Mark file as UPDATED after every edit
- Run check-status daily
- Aggregate changes before major work
- Use descriptive status updates

### ‚ùå DON'T:
- Forget to mark files as UPDATED
- Skip the first-line marker
- Edit currentstatus.md directly (let AI aggregate)
- Mark trivial typo fixes as UPDATED

---

## üîç Common Scenarios

### Scenario 1: I just edited wb-input claude.md
```bash
# Mark it for aggregation
npm run ma
